section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਬੇਦ ਕਤੇਬ ਕਹਹੁ ਮਤ ਝੂਠੇ ਝੂਠਾ ਜੋ ਨ ਬਿਚਾਰੈ ॥
section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Do not say that the Vedas, the Bible and the Koran are false. Those who do not contemplate them are false.

transliteration.text: bēd katēb kahah mat jhūthē jhūthā jō n bichārai .

melody.description: The emotions conveyed in Parbhati are those of extreme devotion; there is an intense confidence and love for the entity it is devoted to. This affection arises from knowledge, common sense and a detailed study. There is therefore an understanding and a considered will to devote itself to that entity.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਜਉ ਸਭ ਮਹਿ ਏਕੁ ਖੁਦਾਇ ਕਹਤ ਹਉ ਤਉ ਕਿਉ ਮੁਰਗੀ ਮਾਰੈ ॥੧॥
section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You say that the One Lord is in all, so why do you kill chickens? ||1||

transliteration.text: jau sabh mah ēk khudāi kahat hau tau kiu muragī mārai .1.

melody.description: The emotions conveyed in Parbhati are those of extreme devotion; there is an intense confidence and love for the entity it is devoted to. This affection arises from knowledge, common sense and a detailed study. There is therefore an understanding and a considered will to devote itself to that entity.

section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O Mullah, tell me: is this God's Justice?

melody.description: The emotions conveyed in Parbhati are those of extreme devotion; there is an intense confidence and love for the entity it is devoted to. This affection arises from knowledge, common sense and a detailed study. There is therefore an understanding and a considered will to devote itself to that entity.

text: ਤੇਰੇ ਮਨ ਕਾ ਭਰਮੁ ਨ ਜਾਈ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The doubts of your mind have not been dispelled. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: tērē man kā bharam n jāī .1. rahāu .

melody.description: The emotions conveyed in Parbhati are those of extreme devotion; there is an intense confidence and love for the entity it is devoted to. This affection arises from knowledge, common sense and a detailed study. There is therefore an understanding and a considered will to devote itself to that entity.

text: ਪਕਰਿ ਜੀਉ ਆਨਿਆ ਦੇਹ ਬਿਨਾਸੀ ਮਾਟੀ ਕਉ ਬਿਸਮਿਲਿ ਕੀਆ ॥
section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You seize a living creature, and then bring it home and kill its body; you have killed only the clay.

transliteration.text: pakar jīu āniā dēh bināsī mātī kau bisamil kīā .

melody.description: The emotions conveyed in Parbhati are those of extreme devotion; there is an intense confidence and love for the entity it is devoted to. This affection arises from knowledge, common sense and a detailed study. There is therefore an understanding and a considered will to devote itself to that entity.

text: ਜੋਤਿ ਸਰੂਪ ਅਨਾਹਤ ਲਾਗੀ ਕਹੁ ਹਲਾਲੁ ਕਿਆ ਕੀਆ ॥੨॥
section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The light of the soul passes into another form. So tell me, what have you killed? ||2||

transliteration.text: jōt sarūp anāhat lāgī kah halāl kiā kīā .2.

melody.description: The emotions conveyed in Parbhati are those of extreme devotion; there is an intense confidence and love for the entity it is devoted to. This affection arises from knowledge, common sense and a detailed study. There is therefore an understanding and a considered will to devote itself to that entity.

text: ਕਿਆ ਉਜੂ ਪਾਕੁ ਕੀਆ ਮੁਹੁ ਧੋਇਆ ਕਿਆ ਮਸੀਤਿ ਸਿਰੁ ਲਾਇਆ ॥
section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: And what good are your purifications? Why do you bother to wash your face? And why do you bother to bow your head in the mosque?

transliteration.text: kiā ujū pāk kīā muh dhōiā kiā masīt sir lāiā .

melody.description: The emotions conveyed in Parbhati are those of extreme devotion; there is an intense confidence and love for the entity it is devoted to. This affection arises from knowledge, common sense and a detailed study. There is therefore an understanding and a considered will to devote itself to that entity.

text: ਜਉ ਦਿਲ ਮਹਿ ਕਪਟੁ ਨਿਵਾਜ ਗੁਜਾਰਹੁ ਕਿਆ ਹਜ ਕਾਬੈ ਜਾਇਆ ॥੩॥
section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Your heart is full of hypocrisy; what good are your prayers or your pilgrimage to Mecca? ||3||

transliteration.text: jau dil mah kapat nivāj gujārah kiā haj kābai jāiā .3.

melody.description: The emotions conveyed in Parbhati are those of extreme devotion; there is an intense confidence and love for the entity it is devoted to. This affection arises from knowledge, common sense and a detailed study. There is therefore an understanding and a considered will to devote itself to that entity.

text: ਤੂੰ ਨਾਪਾਕੁ ਪਾਕੁ ਨਹੀ ਸੂਝਿਆ ਤਿਸ ਕਾ ਮਰਮੁ ਨ ਜਾਨਿਆ ॥
section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You are impure; you do not understand the Pure Lord. You do not know His Mystery.

transliteration.text: tūn nāpāk pāk nahī sūjhiā tis kā maram n jāniā .

melody.description: The emotions conveyed in Parbhati are those of extreme devotion; there is an intense confidence and love for the entity it is devoted to. text: ਕਹਿ ਕਬੀਰ ਭਿਸਤਿ ਤੇ ਚੂਕਾ ਦੋਜਕ ਸਿਉ ਮਨੁ ਮਾਨਿਆ ॥੪॥੪॥
section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Kabeer, you have missed out on paradise; your mind is set on hell. ||4||4||

transliteration.text: kah kabīr bhisat tē chūkā dōjak siu man māniā .4.4.
